channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: “Working in the U.S.: CPT & Internships” Workshop to be Held for Graduate Students
item.description: Date: Thursday, January 30, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Be sure to register to join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for this in-person workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information specific to graduate students, and space is limited….

item.title: Join the MANE Student Advisor Council for Cookies, Coffee, and Commentary!
item.description: Date: Friday, January 24, 2025 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Stop by the table on the second floor of the JEC to provide the MANE Department with feedback on the Fall 2024 semester, and enjoy free cookies and coffee while you’re there!

item.title: Don’t Forget the Therapy Dog Sessions!
item.description: Date: Thursday, January 23, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - Join other students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.

item.title: First Part of Student MHFA Certification Training Being Offered January 24
item.description: Date: Friday, January 24, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Mueller Center Campus Recreation and Wellness team will be offering Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) certification trainings for students. If you have questions about this event, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Free Screening of “Gaza Surf Club” Slated for January 24
item.description: Date: Friday, January 24, 2025 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Rensselaer Voices for Palestine is hosting a free movie screening of “Gaza Surf Club,” a film that follows the story of Palestinians in Gaza who turn to surfing as a source of freedom. Complimentary food will be provided!
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group to Hold Monthly Meeting
item.description: At 4:00pm on Wednesday, January 22 in Amos Eaton 217, all are welcome to join Cameron Cogburn from the Physics Department for a presentation on quantum simulation problems, including the Spin-Boson model, Schwinger Model, and Ising Model scattering. Please contact Tom Morgan if you are interested in presenting at future meetings.

item.title: 2025 Capital District Mayor’s Cup
item.description: Saturday, January 25 - MVP Arena, Albany. Women’s Game 3 p.m. | Men’s Game 6 p.m. Join us for one of our favorite ice hockey traditions as the Engineers compete for the Capital District Mayor’s Cup against the Union College Garnet Chargers. RPI Community Tickets are $20 and can be purchased in person or over the phone at the RPI Houston Field House box office or at the MVP Arena box office (additional fees may apply).

Please be sure to visit the training page link below for a listing of sessions, dates, times, format, and a link to register. Link to trainings: Teaching and Learning Collaboratory Workshop

item.title: Arch Away Semester Reflection to be Held January 29
item.description: Join the CCPD, OUE, and Student Success on Wednesday, January 29 from 4pm to 6pm in DCC 318 to celebrate and reflect on students’ arch away experience from Spring, Summer, or Fall 2024! If your arch away experience is approaching, attend to hear from other students about what they did and how it benefitted them. Faculty and staff are also encouraged to attend!

item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store will be holding its Spring 2025 Backpack Sale January 7-24. Stop by and enjoy 20% off select non-imprinted backpacks in the store!

item.title: TIAA to Offer Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling February 3
item.description: Date: Monday, February 3, 2025 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. item.title: ChatGPT/AI Tools Informal Community Space Created
item.description: An informal community Webex space has been created to collaborate on AI tool use in the classroom, and is available to share, collaborate, and brainstorm on this topic in an informal asynchronous setting. Interested faculty, staff, or graduate TAs who would like to be added to this community cohort space are asked to please email Maureen Fodera.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Fac/Staff Quick Learn Webinar to Offer Tips for Engaging Students
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 11:00 AM - 11:30 AM - Assigning reading assignments and micro video lectures prior to class are great ways for students to gather initial knowledge. Register to join Maureen Fodera, of the Office of Undergraduate Education, as she offers tips on how instructors can use these means to engage and motivate students and help them extract important details/understandings.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
